Articles.Content: I've noticed in the latest patch that enabling angle snapping causes parts to snap vertically to the exact center of the piece, and cannot be moved up and down. This is very inconvinient when I want to put parts on at the top or bottom of it, as I must disable the angle snap, which means my parts will be off-center. Is there any way to change it back to how it was before the patch, or better yet, a way to make vertical snapping work the same way horizontal snapping works? I'm sorry if this has been posted before, but I searched for it and nothing came up.

Was not aware stock added a vertical snap.

Do you have editor extension installed? 'V' toggles vertical snap in it.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/38768-0-23-Editor-Extensions-v0-6-5-Aug-%28EdTools-Editor-Tools-replacement%29
This is my guess at the issue you are experiencing.

I have never installed any mod or extension. I have also tried hitting buttons on the keyboard, but none have had any effect I was not already aware of. Is it just me with this? Or are others experiencing vertical snapping as well?

Settings.cfg:

VAB_ANGLE_SNAP_INCLUDE_VERTICAL = False

I'm not sure if this actually does anything (haven't tried it) but it does exist nonetheless.
